intro: Waltheria reticulata f. acamata, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, rich soils and full sun to partial shade. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many flowering vines and climbers. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardeners, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
